definition: lit. slap the table and shout with praise (idiom); fig. wonderful!/amazing!/great!
to pat/to clap/to slap/to swat/to take (a photo)/to shoot (a film)/racket (sports)/beat (music)
(legal) case/incident/record/file/table
variant of 叫[jiao4]
to shout/to call/to order/to ask/to be called/by (indicates agent in the passive mood)
to cut short/extinct/to disappear/to vanish/absolutely/by no means
variant of 絕|绝[jue2]

sentences.english: His skill level was simply astounding .
sentences.chinese: 他的技术水平令人拍案叫绝。

sentences.english: It may have been my greatest "Wow! "moment in all of sports.
sentences.chinese: 那是我一切体育观看经历当中，最为拍案叫绝的时刻。

sentences.english: Amazingly enough, your phone rings in area 215.
sentences.chinese: 拍案叫绝不够，你的电话铃声面积215。

sentences.english: Their set designs are always stunning.
sentences.chinese: 他们的布景设计经常让人拍案叫绝。

sentences.english: "Hoisting ring's king" rookie player Chen Yibing has demonstrated brilliant performance which made me clap the table.
sentences.chinese: “吊环王”小将陈一冰的精彩表现令我拍案叫绝。

sentences.english: Of course, made me this lovely is published.
sentences.chinese: 当然，更让我拍案叫绝的是出版这件事。

sentences.english: We were overwhelmed with admiration for the superb performance.
sentences.chinese: 精彩的表演令人拍案叫绝。

definition: (idiom) to gasp in amazement/to acclaim as the peak of perfection
to be full of praise (idiom)
(to gasp) with admiration
to slap the table in amazement (idiom); wonderful!/amazing!
a pleasant change/a breath of fresh air/refreshing
exquisite
uproarious/hilarious/to split one's sides laughing/lit. to hold one's belly with both hands
uproarious/hilarious/to split one's sides laughing/lit. to hold one's belly with both hands
to cause one (to do sth)/to make one (angry, delighted etc)
to enchant/fascinating
to exclaim in admiration
cannot help laughing/unable to restrain a smile
endlessly interesting (idiom)/very witty
to exceed all expectations/to come as a surprise
one's thoughts fly to a longed-for place or person/to long for/infatuated/fascinated
to exclaim in astonishment
